author: Special Correspondent
text:
Noted writer S. Ramakrishnan reviewed the novel ‘Crime and Punishment’, authored by the renowned Russian writer Fyodor M. Dostoyevsky, at the weekly book review session brought up by the Readers’ Circle of Paalam the Book Meet book stall in the city on Sunday.

The review of ‘Crime and Punishment’ was in connection with the 150th year of publication of this great novel. Mr. Ramakrishnan said that the novel put Dostoevsky at the forefront of Russian writers when it appeared in 1866 and was now one of the most famous and influential novels in world literature.

He said that Dostoevsky was a multi-faceted personality – a novelist, journalist and short story writer. Dostoevsky commanded respect among the entire writers fraternity across the globe, he noted. Many writers and senior literary personalities celebrated his presence.

ostoyevsky was graduated as military engineer from Army Engineering College in St. Petersburg city, but resigned to devote himself to writing.

He took part in politics and participated in agitations against the government. Though he did not take serious participation in the agitations, still the government preferred to arrest him and put him behind the bars. Through the story of the brilliant, but conflicted young Raskolnikov and the murder he commits, Fyodor Dostoevsky explores the theme of redemption through suffering.

“Crime and Punishment” was first published in a Russian literary journal in monthly instalments in 1866. It was later brought out as a novel. It is the second Dostoevsky’s full-length novels following his return from ten years exile in Siberia.
title: ‘Crime and Punishment’ is now 150
